user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_calc_hash:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
digest_calc_hash (struct DigestAlgorithm *da, uint8_t *digest)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->uninitialised);
  mhd_assert (da->algo_selected);
  mhd_assert (da->ready_for_hashing);
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5 == da->algo)
  {
#ifdef MHD_MD5_HAS_FINISH
    MHD_MD5_finish (&da->ctx.md5_ctx, digest);
#ifdef _DEBUG
    da->ready_for_hashing = false;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#else  /* ! MHD_MD5_HAS_FINISH */
    MHD_MD5_finish_reset (&da->ctx.md5_ctx, digest);
#ifdef _DEBUG
    da->ready_for_hashing = true;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#endif /* ! MHD_MD5_HAS_FINISH */
  }
  else
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 == da->algo)
  {
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_HAS_FINISH
    MHD_SHA256_finish (&da->ctx.sha256_ctx, digest);
#ifdef _DEBUG
    da->ready_for_hashing = false;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#else  /* ! MHD_SHA256_HAS_FINISH */
    MHD_SHA256_finish_reset (&da->ctx.sha256_ctx, digest);
#ifdef _DEBUG
    da->ready_for_hashing = true;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
#endif /* ! MHD_SHA256_HAS_FINISH */
  }
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
  {
    MHD_SHA512_256_finish (&da->ctx.sha512_256_ctx, digest);
#ifdef _DEBUG
    da->ready_for_hashing = false;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
  }
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  mhd_assert (0);   /* Should not happen */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  da->hashing = false;
#endif /* _DEBUG */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
MHD_MD5_finish (&da->ctx.md5_ctx, digest);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment as written. The call MHD_MD5_finish(&da->ctx.md5_ctx, digest) invokes an external finish function and does not itself constitute a call to digest_calc_hash. A 17.2 violation would only occur if MHD_MD5_finish were implemented (or macro-expanded) to call digest_calc_hash (directly) or to call another function that eventually calls digest_calc_hash (indirect recursion). Without evidence that MHD_MD5_finish aliases or invokes digest_calc_hash, Rule 17.2 is not violated.
